name: Securitydaylille1.GitHub.io
body:
### Security Day Lille 1 - 16th January 2015

The very first edition of the Security Day will be held in Lille1 university (France) the 16th of January, 2015. 
Security Day is a symposium on computer security organized by a group of students enrolled in the [TIIR master degree](http://fil.univ-lille1.fr/master-informatique/tiir/). 

![university logo](http://www.univ-lille1.fr/digitalAssets/38/38040_logo-trans.png)

### Sponsors

TBD

### Partners 
TBD 

![DOAR-E](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SecurityDayLille1/SecurityDayLille1.github.io/master/images/doare_400x400.jpeg)

### Venue

+ From Lille Flandres train station  
    Metro Line 1 (Yellow) towards 4 Cantons Stade Pierre Mauroy. Stop at Cite Scientifique. 
+ From Lille Europe train station 
    Walk to the Lille Flandres train station 
    or
    Metro Line 2 (Red) towards St. Philibert. Stop at Lille Flandres.
+ Useful links
    Transpoles [metro lines](http://www.transpole.fr/fr/metro_tram/lignes-metro.aspx)

### Schedule

TBD

### Talks (provisonal)
+ (  ) Keynote : TBD
+ (  ) TBD
+ (FR) Recherche de vulnérabilités
+ (FR) Program analysis: dynamic binary analysis and instrumentation
+ (EN) Memory analysis: a volatility primer
+ (EN) Inside VMProtect
+ (EN) Theorem provers, symbolic executions and reverse code engineering
+ (FR) Solving NoSuchCrackme level3: a remote side-channel attack on RSA

### Speakers (provisonal)

#### [Emilien 'Trance' Girault](https://twitter.com/emiliengirault) 
Emilien Girault is a security auditor and pentester at ANSSI (French Network and Information Security Agency). His     main fields of interest include vulnerability exploitation, cryptography and reverse engineering of PLC firmwares and     client-server applications. He enjoys participating in various security challenges, such as SSTIC and NoSuchCon. He's the author of several articles published on old blogs like Ghosts In The Stack and Sogeti ESEC, as well as DOAR-E and French magazine MISC.
#### [Jonathan 'Djo' Salwan](https://twitter.com/JonathanSalwan)
Jonathan Salwan is a junior security researcher at Quarkslab who has a strong interest in low-level computing and program analysis. His research is mostly focused on both static and dynamic program analysis. 
#### [Mariano 'Emdel' Graziano](https://twitter.com/emd3l)
Mariano Graziano is currently a Ph.D. student at the Software and System Security group of Institut Eurecom in Sophia-Antipolis. In his thesis, he tries to protect the world by developing new automated techniques to analyze malwares and to defeat chaos in physical memory dumps.
#### [Aurélien 'Dad' Wailly](https://twitter.com/awailly)
Aurélien Wailly is an engineer in cloud computing security at Orange Labs. His primary research interest is the application of autonomic concepts to adapt security to cloud environments. He also studies underlying virtualization security to lower attack surface and provide remediation.
